com.filipemcoelho.GeneralAPIs

Class FullName

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.filipemcoelho.GeneralAPIs.FullName

  • public class FullName
extends Object
    The FullName class is a class that validates and controls the Name of a person correcting user mistakes.

    It's accessors and private methods are prepared to accept any type of String validating and correcting it as necessary to formulate what we know as a Name (Personal Name + optional middle names + Family Name). For mononym persons, where only a name is given, the lastName is considered to be empty with "" and name given (main name) will be considered to be the personal one, firstName.

    It also, overrides some Java API methods, as the Object.toString method.
    Author:
    Filipe Coelho
    See Also:
    Object.toString()

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private String firstName
      (Mandatory) field to produce result, First Name
      private ArrayList<String> fullName
      Contains all names in the correct order: firstName, middleNames, lastName
      private String knowName
      (Not mandatory) Field to describe a person that's not treated by the actual firstName, but from other name
      private String lastName
      (Mandatory) field to produce result, Last Name of
      private String middleNames
      (Not Mandatory) field to produce result, First Name

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FullName(String firstName)
      Optional constructor to accommodate mononym persons.
      FullName(String firstName, String lastName)
      Secondary constructor, where possibly, a Name is created with just the firstName and lastName fields available The constructor calls the main constructor, giving the default "" (empty String argument) as a middleNames
      FullName(String firstName, String middleNames, String lastName)
      Main constructor where all name fields are filled.

      • setFirstName

        public void setFirstName(String firstName)
        setter / mutator method to alter the firstName field with a trim() result of the String argument Calls the countWordValidation to count the words the parameter has. If parameter has more than one word it will throw an exception and keep just the first word. After validation, calls the fixName to fix the variables and fill the fullName ArrayList correctly
        Parameters:
        firstName - A String stating the firstName

      • setMiddleNames

        public void setMiddleNames(String middleNames)
        Note: calling the setMiddleNames will substitute all names: Field middleNames Any name between the first (index 0) and last name of the array (index length()-1) calling the fixName() method
        Parameters:
        middleNames - String with all middle names

      • setLastName

        public void setLastName(String lastName)
        setter / mutator method to alter the lastName field with a trim() result of the String argument Calls the countWordValidation to count the words the parameter has. If parameter has more than one word it will throw an exception and keep just the first word. After validation, calls the fixName to fix the variables and fill the fullName ArrayList correctly
        Parameters:
        lastName - A String stating the lastName

      • setFullName

        public void setFullName(String fullName)
        Note: Calling this method, substitutes all fields of the name: 
              firstName; middleNames; lastName;
        And organizes the fullName ArrayList with the fixName method.
        Parameters:
        fullName - The full name string

      • countWordValidation

        private static int countWordValidation(String string)
        Counts the number of words of a String
        Parameters:
        string - The String to be validated
        Returns:
        returns an int with the count of the words

      • fixName

        private void fixName()
        This method enters the name in the correct order into the ArrayList fullName. 
         First:   Separates middleNames in a  List
 Second:  Enters the names in the list int the correct order
 Third:    Arranges the input of the names calling (@code arrangeName) method,
          trimming the result to prevent white spaces in the name
 Forth:   Fixes the Fields

      • arrangeName

        private static String arrangeName(String string)
        Arranges the String in the following way: First capital letter Rest with lowercase letters 
              "filIpe" returns "Filipe"
        Parameters:
        string - The String to be fixed
        Returns:
        the fixed string

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides the Object class toString method, giving the result as we want to produce the FullName class
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a String format of the ArrayList fullName
        Since:
        1.8

      • printName

        public void printName()
        If necessary, call this method to show the (@code fullName) ArrayList on the console
